Detailed Description

Class EdgeIndex implements a simple n-dimensional integer vector for edge centered variables. Edge indices contain an integer index location in AMR index space along with the designated edge axis (X=0, Y=1, or Z=2). See the edge box geometry class for more information about the mapping between the AMR index space and the edge indices.

See also:
hier::Index

pdat::EdgeData

pdat::EdgeGeometry

pdat::EdgeIterator

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SAMRAI::pdat::EdgeIndex::EdgeIndex ( const tbox::Dimension &  dim  )  [explicit]

The default constructor for a edge index creates an uninitialized index.

SAMRAI::pdat::EdgeIndex::EdgeIndex ( const hier::Index &  rhs,
const int  axis,
const int  edge 
)

Construct a edge index from a regular index, axis, and edge. The axis can be one of EdgeIndex::X (0), EdgeIndex::Y (1), or EdgeIndex::Z (2). The edge argument can be one of the constants EdgeIndex::LowerLeft (0), EdgeIndex::LowerRight(1), EdgeIndex::UpperLeft (2) or EdgeIndex::UpperRight(3).

SAMRAI::pdat::EdgeIndex::EdgeIndex ( const EdgeIndex &  rhs  ) 

The copy constructor creates a edge index equal to the argument.

SAMRAI::pdat::EdgeIndex::~EdgeIndex (  ) 

The edge index destructor does nothing interesting.

The assignment operator sets the edge index equal to the argument.

int SAMRAI::pdat::EdgeIndex::getAxis (  )  const [inline]

Get the axis for which this edge index is defined (X=0, Y=1, Z=2).

void SAMRAI::pdat::EdgeIndex::setAxis ( const int  axis  )  [inline]

Set the edge axis (X=0, Y=1, Z=2).

hier::Index SAMRAI::pdat::EdgeIndex::toCell ( const int  edge  )  const

For dimension 2, converts the edge index into the index on the lower side (argument edge = 0) or the upper side (argument edge = 1) of the edge. For dimension 3, converts the edge index into the index on the lower left (argument edge == 0), the lower right (argument edge == 1), the upper left (argument edge == 2), or the upper right (argument edge == 3) of thw edge.

bool SAMRAI::pdat::EdgeIndex::operator== ( const EdgeIndex &  rhs  )  const [inline]

Returns true if two edge index objects are equal. All components and the corresponding edge axes must be the same for equality.

bool SAMRAI::pdat::EdgeIndex::operator!= ( const EdgeIndex &  rhs  )  const [inline]

Returns true if two edge index objects are not equal. Any of the components or axes may be different for inequality.
